page.title: 16POPULATION CUCKFIELD RURAL
page.content: There has been no new building and therefore no increase in the popu- lation for many years. All the land along the east side of the road is part of the Borde Hill estate owned by Robert Clarke and is held under agree- ment that it must not be sold or built on.Permission has been given recently for one field to be used for recrea- tion,but local anger was roused when motor cycle racing was held there and protests were made.The houses here are widely spaced and some,originally farm houses are very old,and one called Taylor's Barn,occupied by Mrs. Watney and her housekeeper,has changed very little since it was built 400 years ago.It has a well by the door and this is never dry as it is fed from one of the many springs that come to the surface here and run into the Ouse.
